question: During the first week of August 2015, one of the NASA Astronomy Pictures of the Day shows the lights of a city on the horizon. The namesake of this city also has a landmark building in Chicago named after him. What is the name of the architectural firm that designed this landmark building? Give the first name appearing in the name of the firm as of June 2023.

trajectory.question: During the first week of August 2015, one of the NASA Astronomy Pictures of the Day shows the lights of a city on the horizon. The namesake of this city also has a landmark building in Chicago named after him. What is the name of the architectural firm that designed this landmark building? Give the first name appearing in the name of the firm as of June 2023.

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to identify which APOD in early August 2015 shows city lights on the horizon and determine the city it references.

args.query: site:apod.nasa.gov August 2015 APOD lights of a city on the horizon

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. 2015 August 21 - Sprites from Space - APOD
   URL: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap150821.html
   Site: apod.nasa.gov
   Date: Aug 21, 2015
   Summary: Below, city lights and lightning flashes from thunderstorms appear over southern Mexico. The snapshot also captures the startling apparition ...

2. 2015 August 3 - A Proton Arc Over Lake Superior - APOD
   URL: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap150803.html
   Site: apod.nasa.gov
   Date: Aug 3, 2015
   Summary: In the featured image, the yellow lights on the horizon are the city lights of Marquette, Michigan, USA. The blue and yellow rocks in the ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to confirm which APOD shows the city lights and identify the city mentioned.

args.query: APOD 2015 August 3 A Proton Arc Over Lake Superior yellow lights on the horizon Marquette

tool_executed.name: enhanced_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 web results with content:

1. Astronomy Photo of the Day is a Proton Arc Over Lake Superior
   URL: https://www.illustratedcuriosity.com/earth/astronomy-photo-of-the-day-is-a-proton-arc-over-lake-superior//
   Site: illustratedcuriosity.com
   Summary: In the featured image, the yellow lights on the horizon are the city lights of Marquette, Michigan, USA. The blue and yellow rocks in the Lake Superior ...
   Content: Astronomy Photo of the Day is a Proton Arc Over Lake Superior Loading... MENU MENU Home Earth Economics Environment Climate Environmental Tech Pollution Wildlife Health Health Tech Medicine Nutrition Exercise History Prehistory Ancient History Postclassical Era Modern History Humans Human Brain Psychology Life Animals & Plants Genetics Paleontology Evolution Genetic Engineering Physics Space Astrobiology Astronomy Extrasolar Planets Space Tech Spaceflight Technology Artificial Intelligence Energy Engineering Materials Robotics Vehicles Search for: Astronomy Photo of the Day is a Proton Arc Over Lake Superior Home / Earth / Astronomy Photo of the Day is a Proton Arc Over Lake Superior C-J Earth | August 17, 2015 Ken Williams / NASA Ken Williams is a photographer who recently took this amazingly beautiful photo west of Munising near the Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore in Michigan, U.S. The photo was chosen by NASA to be featured as their Astronomy Picture of the Day. It captures the natural phenomena called a “proton arc” (aurora) as it silhouetted against a beautiful starry sky. NASA describes the photo as follows: The setting had been picked out — all that was needed was an aurora. And late last August, forecasts predicted that an otherwise beautiful night sky would be lit up with auroral green. Jumping into his truck, the astrophotographer approached his secret site — but only after a five hour drive across the rural Upper Peninsula of Michigan. What he didn’t know was that his luck was just beginning. While setting up for the image, a proton arc — a rare type of aurora — appeared. The red arc lasted only about 15 minutes, but that was long enough to capture in a 30-second exposure. As the name indicates, proton arcs are caused not by electrons but by more massive protons that bombard the Earth’s atmosphere following an energetic event on the Sun. In the featured image, the yellow lights on the horizon are the city lights of Marquette, Michigan, USA. The blue and

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
- The APOD from 2015 August 3 mentions the city lights of Marquette, Michigan on the horizon.
- The city is named after Jacques Marquette, who is also the namesake of Chicago’s Marquette Building.
- The Marquette Building was designed by Holabird and Roche; the firm’s name as of June 2023 is Holabird and Root.
- The first name appearing in the firm’s name is Holabird.

FINAL ANSWER: Holabird

messages.name: enhanced_search

messages.content:
- The APOD from 2015 August 3 mentions the city lights of Marquette, Michigan on the horizon.
- The city is named after Jacques Marquette, who is also the namesake of Chicago’s Marquette Building.
- The Marquette Building was designed by Holabird and Roche; the firm’s name as of June 2023 is Holabird and Root.
- The first name appearing in the firm’s name is Holabird.

FINAL ANSWER: Holabird
